title: Whatever happened to the Novavax Covid vaccine?
description: The jab, seen as an alternative for people who are vaccine-hesitant, is widely available in the EU but still not cleared for use in the UK.

title: Climate change: 'We're making wine in Norway'
description: Vineyards are moving further north, but new winemakers say they struggle to be taken seriously.

title: Invictus Games: Prince Harry and Meghan join opening ceremony in the Netherlands
description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have not been on this side of the Atlantic together since 2020.

title: Nigeria's Chibok girls: Why was this former captive treated differently?
description: Hassana Adamu speaks to the BBC about feeling neglected on the eighth anniversary of the kidnappings.

title: 'Bell-ringing is more than a call to prayer'
description: Meet the family of church bell-ringers in east London, who practised for Easter Sunday.

title: Ukraine war scams: Cybercriminals stole my identity
description: Scammers are using emotionally charged tricks in a bid to steal online donations.

title: Man opens tiny cafe in garage between Bristol houses
description: Rob Savage wanted to add to the sense of the community created during the Covid lockdowns.

title: Conor Benn v Chris van Heerden: British welterweight secures second-round knockout in Manchester
description: Conor Benn makes short work of South Africa's Chris van Heerden as the British welterweight continues his charge towards a world title shot.

title: Ukraine round-up: Residents rebuild Bucha as Russia bans UK PM
description: A few residents clear up after Russia's occupation, as Boris Johnson becomes persona non grata in Moscow.

title: Russian warship: Moskva crew 'shown for first time since sinking'
description: Russia's defence ministry releases a video purportedly showing the crew of the Moskva in Sevastopol.

title: Sunken Russian warship Moskva: What do we know?
description: Russia says the Moskva sank after an explosion of ammunition, but Ukrainians say they hit it with missiles.

title: Liverpool: Have Reds struck blow over Manchester City after FA Cup semi-final win?
description: Have Liverpool struck a psychological blow over Manchester City in the race for domestic and European glory with their FA Cup semi-final win?

title: BMX: Childhood memories feature in 'untold story'
description: From E.T. to the Olympics, the eye-catching sport is being celebrated in a new book.

title: Patrick Lyoya: Could rethink of US police traffic stops save lives?
description: The death of a black man in Michigan after a traffic stop raises questions about police use of force.

title: Patel personally approved Rwanda plan despite concerns
description: A civil servants union says the plan is "divisive" but officials will have to implement it or leave.

title: Billie Jean King Cup: Great Britain's Emma Raducanu loses to Czech Republic's Marketa Vondrousova
description: Emma Raducanu loses on day two of Great Britain's Billie Jean King Cup qualifier in the Czech Republic, meaning Harriet Dart must win her match to keep the tie alive.

title: Extinction Rebellion: Six arrested after Olympians scale oil tanker
description: Extinction Rebellion protesters, including two Olympians, scaled the tanker in London.

title: Ukraine war: L'Occitane U-turn as it closes Russian shops
description: The firm says military action in Ukraine means it will shut its shops, having defended staying open.

title: Nathan Fleetwood: Body found in river in missing man search
description: Police looking for Nathan Fleetwood who was missing for 19 days find a body in a river.

title: Ukraine war: Russia bans Boris Johnson from country over Ukraine war
description: Boris Johnson and other senior ministers are barred over the UK's "hostile" stance on the war in Ukraine.

title: Bleed kits in memory of stabbed Essex teenager Liam Taylor
description: Liam Taylor, 19, was stabbed to death and his grandmother is on a mission to fund life-saving bleed kits.

title: How Instagram opened a new world for Welsh quilting
description: Once thrown out as old bedding, quilts are all the rage on social media and inspiring a new generation.

title: River pollution: Rescuer infected with sewage-linked parasite
description: Lifeboat volunteer David Deveney spent three days in hospital after a river training session.

title: Ukraine war: No quick return to normal for scarred Bucha
description: Everything has changed in this town since the Russians came, and horrific memories will not easily be erased.

title: Dua Lipa's Future Nostalgia tour confirms she's Britain's best pop star
description: The pop star plays the first UK date of her Future Nostalgia tour, two years later than planned.

title: Council tax rebate: Warning issued over new scam pretending to offer £150
description: Fraudsters are cold-calling people asking for bank details to receive the £150 rebate, say councils.

title: Mastermind: Inside the world of competitive quizzing
description: Mastermind winner Alice Walker revealed herself as a quiz league player, but what do they involve?

title: 'The Post Office interrogated me for hours'
description: There are calls to ban the Post Office from bringing private prosecutions following the Horizon IT scandal.

title: What's the problem with calories on restaurant menus?
description: The new rules are taking away the joy of going out for a meal for some people with eating disorders.

title: Climate change: Key UN finding widely misinterpreted
description: Suggestions emissions could rise for another three years without dangerous warming are wrong, scientists say.

title: US zoo celebrates 50 years of giant pandas
description: The tradition of gifted pandas to the US from China hits a 50-year mark at Washington DC's National Zoo.

title: DR Congo conflict: Hiding on top of a hill to escape the rebels
description: Some 50,000 people have found a place of sanctuary from the myriad armed groups in eastern DR Congo.

title: Sanctioned Russian oligarchs linked to £800m worth of UK property
description: A dozen sanctioned Russians are linked to an estimated £800m worth of property in the UK, BBC analysis reveals.
